text.p: Medical information systems provider HBO & Company said Tuesday it signed an agreement to buy GMIS Inc., a Pennsylvania-based provider of clinical database information systems for managed care.
Shares of GMIS jumped $6.625, or nearly 39 percent, to $23.75 on Nasdaq. HBO fell $1.375 to $62.375, also on Nasdaq.

HBO said under the agreement, GMIS shareholders will get 0.42 of a share of HBO common stock for each share of GMIS common, as long as the average HBO share price remains between $47.62 and $64 during the pricing period.
If the average rises above $64 or falls below $47.62 a share, HBO said, GMIS shareholders will get a fraction of a share of HBOC common valued at $26.88 or $20.00, respectively, per GMIS share.
The deal awaits regulatory and GMIS shareholder approval. HBO said it would be accounted for as a pooling of interests and close during the fourth quarter of 1996.
Atlanta-based HBO provides patient care and financial and management software products to hospitals, clinics and doctors.
GMIS, based in Malvern, Pa., had 1995 revenue of $36 million.
